assignments.title: Math Detective: Addition
assignments.description:
##LEARNING##
Addition means putting groups of numbers together to find out how many there are in total. For example, if you have 2 apples and someone gives you 3 more, you add them: 2 + 3 = 5 apples! You can count them all to get the answer. When we add numbers up to 10, our total answer will always be 10 or less.

##QUIZ##
1. What is 3 + 2?A) 4B) 5*C) 6D) 72. If you have 4 toys and get 1 more, how many do you have now?A) 3B) 4C) 5*D) 63. What is the answer to 6 + 0?A) 0B) 1C) 6*D) 74. Choose the correct sum for 5 + 5.A) 9B) 10*C) 11D) 555. If a bird has 7 worms and finds 2 more, how many worms does it have in total?A) 8B) 9*C) 10D) 726. What is 1 + 8?A) 7B) 8C) 9*D) 107. Sarah has 2 blue balloons and 3 red balloons. How many balloons does she have altogether?A) 2B) 3C) 4D) 5*
